empty: The herb stores are empty and bare, this does not bode well.
m_c shifts nervously, staring at the empty herb stores.
m_c couldn't even treat a thorn in a paw with so little supplies. The herb stores need replenishing.
Seeing the empty herb stores makes m_c shiver slightly and puff out {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur.
Without any herbs m_c feels helpless.
c_n needs a herb gathering patrol yesterday, the herb stores are entirely empty and m_c feels like {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} going to vibrate out of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} skin.
low: m_c worries over the herb stores, there isn't nearly enough for the whole Clan.
m_c doesn't think the the current herb supply can handle all the possible ailments {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates may face.
m_c tells {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates to be careful this moon, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can't afford to waste herbs on unnecessary injury.
m_c worriedly recounts the herbs; the Clan can't afford to waste even the driest leaves.
m_c looks at the herb stores and wonders if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'ll have to ask for other Clans' help.
m_c scrounges around the very back of the herb stores, trying to see if there's any wilted leaves that have been overlooked.
m_c is going to talk to lead_name about giving {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a patrol full of warriors. c_n urgently needs more medicinal supplies.
The state of the herb stores makes m_c's pelt prickle with unease.
m_c is going to have to prioritize treating emergency injuries rather than easing more long term pain. The herb stores just don't have enough supplies.

It's rare for m_c to get the chance to clean out the surfaces of the herb stores. The low level of supplies worries {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} determined to find an upside.
adequate: m_c is content with how many herbs the Clan has stocked up.
It's not enough for an emergency, but m_c thinks the Clan has enough herbs for now.
This herb supply can handle most problems, though m_c wonders if it can support the Clan in every situation.
There's enough herbs for now, but m_c considers gathering some more... just in case.
Though there's plenty of room for more, m_c is happy enough with how many herbs the Clan has for now.
Though the supply is decent, m_c knows there aren't enough herbs to face an outbreak if one occurs.
The herb stores aren't critically low, but m_c would feel safer if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} had a little more.
The herb stores could be better stocked. Could be worse though, this isn't too bad.
Hmm. Time to go on a herb gathering patrol, m_c thinks. A pawful of prevention is worth a cat's weight of cure.
As m_c mentally reviews the day's tasks, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/put/puts} herb gathering on the list, though it's not the most important.
Maybe m_c should search for some of the rarer herbs, just to round out c_n's supplies fully.
full: There's plenty of herbs in the den and m_c looks over them approvingly.
m_c has the herb supply well managed, it seems like there's plenty for all manner of ailments.
m_c feels happy with the amount of herbs stored and thinks the Clan is well prepared for any emergency.
m_c looks over the stores with satisfaction; {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/feel/feels} confident that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can handle any emergency.
There's nothing like the satisfaction of a fully stocked herb supply.
Honestly m_c can't see any herb the Clan wants for - their supplies are looking wonderful.
m_c is strongly considering reorganising the stores - but there's too many herbs to make that practical at the moment.
m_c still wants to go out gathering, but it's so nice to feel no pressure about it. c_n is wonderfully stocked with herbs at the moment.
Surrounded by the herb supplies, assaulted on all sides by their potent herbal stink, m_c kneads the ground happily.
excess: The Clan has been blessed with plentiful herbs and m_c struggles to find places to store them all.
The herb stores are overflowing and m_c feels little worry.
The Clan has nothing to worry about, m_c has more than enough herbs for every conceivable problem.
With more herbs than places to store them, m_c wryly wonders if it's possible to have too much of a good thing.
There are so many herbs stored that m_c's only worry is finding the specific herb {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} looking for.
m_c has trouble making {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest - the herb supply is literally overflowing and threatening to invade m_c's bedding.
Sure, m_c has no idea where to put all these extra herbs, but it's a refreshing and reassuring problem to have.
No cat can twitch a whisker in the medicine den right now without bumping into the herb supplies. Herb gathering is not one of c_n's problems.
There are few things better at putting a skip in m_c's steps than having such an overflowing supply of herbs available.

no_meds_warning: With no cat assigned to the medicine den, the Clan is at risk of injuries progressing to infection and fever.
The cats eye the empty medicine den uneasily. They're missing a crucial component of the Clan.
Death and sickness haunt the Clan more often without medicine cats to keep them at bay.
The absence of a medicine cats in the den sticks out like a thorn in a paw.
This isn't right - there should be a source of comfort and guidance in this den, not an uneasy absence and unsettling silence.
single_not_working: m_c's tail twitches with irritation, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/stay/stays} limp with exhaustion. c_n will have to manage without {PRONOUN/m_c/object} this moon.
m_c rests deeply, curled into a tight ball. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/know/knows} that sleep is the only thing that'll get {PRONOUN/m_c/object} back on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} paws.
m_c isn't seeing patients this moon, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} the patient.
m_c just hopes no one does anything mouse-brained this moon. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/aren't/isn't} in any condition to patch anyone up.
Hopefully c_n won't miss m_c's efforts this moon, because {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} aren't in any condition to work.
many_not_working: The medicine cats aren't seeing patients this moon, they are the patients.
Hopefully nothing goes wrong this moon, given that the medicine cats are all unable to work.
Medicine cats make terrible patients, it turns out. Add that to the pile of reasons that c_n hopes they'll be back on their paws soon.
With no working medicine cats, c_n is vulnerable.
